monogr.title: An Earnest perswasion vnto the pastours of Christes churche, whersoeuer thei be dispersed, but especially vnto his Churche of Englande : that as thei haue thruste the plough share into the grounde, so zelously and watchfully to walke forth right, not leanyng to the left hande, neither tournyng to the right, for who so laieth hold of the plough and looketh backe, is not apte for the kingdome of heauen

div.head: To the christian Reader.
div.p:
LEt no man that shall reade, or heare this reade, or any thing within this booke conteined, thinke or imagine the writer hereof is perswaded, or goeth about to perswade, by any woorde, within this booke, that it were meete or conuenience, for any Preacher or Minister, to appoinct vnto hymself, either cappe or other garmente: but that thei are all bounde by the duetie of their alleagance, to weare and doe, all suche orders as the Prince shall appoinct them, to imitate and followe: or els with sainct Peter, by the worde of God, to confuce the same, as neither lawfull nor necessarie. And not by their euill example, suffer the truthe to be shadowed and darckened, the forwarde fathers to bee by the Papistes, condempned as rashe and vnaduised doers. But either to proue them so, or els to defende their quarell, and be content to bowe their sholders to the bearyng of the crosse, the whiche who so refuse to doe
shalbe founde loyterers, and not true labourers. To whom these fewe woordes are dedicated and directed, I truste none other thyng then by the sincere truthe, maie bee sufficiently supported and defended. I desire you not to esteme this to bee dooen of arrogancie, neither to haue any ill meanyng, but onely to craue at your handes; some shorte pitthie woorke to satisfie all men. For a great nomber of the laite will in no wise now goe backe to their old lessons, [beyng now further and muche better enstructed] then to defile theim selues with the giltines of this crime: to the condempnyng of all those reuerende fathers, whiche haue followed the Apostles; in the puritie of perfecte religion, receiued from the primatiue churche. But desire rather to steppe forwarde still, vntill it shall please God to banishe al supersticion clene out of this churche, whiche he sone bring to passe for his Christes sake. Amen, AMEN.
